intro: Hieracium gortanianum, commonly known as the Gortanian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellowish-orange inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium gortanianum is often found in dry meadows, rocky slopes, and alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
